intro: Ficus chiriquiana, commonly known as the Chiriquí fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the humid lowland forests of Panama and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig fruits. Ficus chiriquiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
